Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: WanLing
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room is tiny & yes, it is fairly loud. But I counter both of those by saying "it's New York!" We noticed the noise but were not bothered by it at all. (We do live currently in an urban area.) And the room although very small was not too small - met our needs just fine! The room was neat & clean - the staff very friendly and helpful. And the location was great! Easy access to the subway but we actually spent most of our time walking. We did not feel unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: ThienLanN
Reviews.Content: The location is in the thick of Chinatown. Around the corner is the Canal St. metro station. Also nearby is a HSBC and Bank of America. As for food, you just won't go hungry here. And if Asian food is not your thing, then Little Italy and Soho are nearby. Grocery wise, there's a Whole Foods on Houston and somewhere probably closer is a Trader Joe's. I don't consider this a large distance to walk. Safety-wise, the immediate area is fine. Now if you go further east there are some neighborhoods that I'd not walk alone at night. Just use your judgment. The hotel room itself is clean, but very small. Just enough room really for two people. Oddly enough, I think the bathroom is as large as the entire bedroom. You do get a small fridge, but ours was rank, so we did not use it. Toiletries provided include: shampoo, conditioner, body wash...hair dryer was also provided. Wifi was adequate, but not so much for video streaming. Noise level was ok, but bring ear plugs if you're sensitive. We had a third person with us, and they provided a cot at no extra charge. The service was good. There's really nothing to complain about. This is a nice boutique hotel that gives adequate service. I'd recommend staying here. For the price, you're not going to find something much better.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but terrific”
Reviews.Author: careyes45
Reviews.Content: Smallest room we've stayed in, but that just made it cozy. Loved the modern decor of the room and bathroom. Very comfy bed. Enjoyed the welcome gifts of hot/cold travel cups with hotel logo, tote bag, and snacks. Fridge in the room. Small side tables, desk, and closet, but enough to meet our needs. Excellent location for shopping souvenirs and name brand stores. Lots of places to eat. If you're a big and tall person you might feel cramped. Would recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid_Reisegleder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two weeks, and have no complains about this hotel! Clean, comfortable rooms. I think the size is OK. Kingsize bed, we asked them to change sheets because I was ill, that was no problem. We had a coffeemaker and a fridge, which is perfect in the morning! They gave us supplies every day (coffeebags, soaps, towels). Heating during winter, and A/C during summer. Loved the water and ice machine in the lobby! Perfect location, in Soho, close to China Town. The subway, Canal, has many connection, uptown and downtown. The staff was friendly, and gave us tips about restaurants. You can also use their printer for free, and the wifi connection is fast. Very good stay, for a very good price! Would come back, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Love this staff”
Reviews.Author: Hb D
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but you are in the middle of everything. Clean and safe. Friendly

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: tigerhull19
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with Hotel Azure. The staff were friendly and really helpful with local restaurant tips and things to do that tourists wouldn't know about (the local secrets). Our room was very small but perfectly arranged, and we had completely expected space to be a premium in New York City. The Hotel is at the corner of Little Italy, Soho and ChinaTown, and there is a great buzz around the area, with local delights in close proximity. We were in walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge and the Financial District, and a subway station right next to the Hotel, which definitely helps. The hotel looked after our bags, even once we had checked out for the rest of the day. Free local calls from the hotel. Basically I would sum Hotel Azure up as: Small but perfectly formed. I would happily stay there again. :)

Reviews.Title: “One night stay...”
Reviews.Author: ATXJudie
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel on a Saturday (we had a hotel paid for by work on Friday night). We had a room on the second floor. The front desk people were mostly friendly, and we checked our luggage during the day and then checked into our room that evening. The room was very small, but I was expecting that. Even on the second floor, the street noise/subway noise did not phase us. Being near the street on NYC that was anticipated. The bed didn't have anything but a duvet on it -- but we also didn't bother to call and ask. Other than that the room was nice. The shower was wonky, but worked once we figured it out. We really liked the location and enjoyed walking around Chinatown and Little Italy and found tons of bars/restaurants nearby. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “9/11 stay”
Reviews.Author: Newporthomie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 10 days around Sep 11 2011. Great hotel - friendly staff - great location. Can only recommend this place and would happily stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: HDDizzle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in November. I had a room facing Canal Street on the fourth floor, although it was a little noisy (it is New York!) everything was fantastic. It's in a great location with lots of good places to eat near by. It's within walking distance of a lot of the downtown sights you might want to visit, but that doesn't matter as there are several main subway lines served right out side the hotel which is great for getting the most out of NYC on your visit. The room was clean and tidied everyday and the staff were friendly and helpful. A great stay, I'd be sure to use them again. If you want a great breakfast try Landmark Diner a block up from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Orindaguy
Reviews.Content: Great location with several subway lines outside the front door, one block to Chinatown and Little Italy, comfortable beds. There are no hotel amenities except a very nice 24-hour staff, free wi-fi in all the rooms and reasonably quiet for New York. Yes, the rooms are tiny but I slept well and found loads of places to eat in the neighborhood. They gladly arranged a reasonable private car to JFK for my flight to Rome. It's not cheap but it is compared to other hotels in this most expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to anyone who says this isn't a dump...it is”
Reviews.Author: StevenBSydney
Reviews.Content: I have no clue what anyone sees in this shocker (it has one redeeming feature...which I'll get to). It's a dump...tiny with ZERO space for anything...couldn't even open a bag on the floor. It's on noisy Canal st which must be NYC's worst street...it's awful. Unless you hate all your friends and family; it's ideal to get the worst, tackiest NY gifts imaginable...or fake luxury brand bags..it's dreadful. The room is noisy, shakes from the subway and is tired, stale and soulless..and it's not cheap...in November (not peak season) a room is still over $300!!!! It IS NOT Soho..it may be on Lafayette but this is most certainly Chinatown (and not a quirky, restaurant laden fun type of Chinatown). It's only decent feature??? a very comfortable bed. I was booked in for three night's...cancelled after seeing the lobby. But instead of forfeiting the night 1 night fee for nothing, I cancelled but used the room...big mistake! I should have eaten the $300 and gone elsewhere...this place is dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: Hazel G
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with no expectations - you go for a budget hotel at 2.5 star therefore dont expect the Waldorf Astoria! I have to say i was plesantly surprised. I have read some of the reviews on here and wonder if people may have expected more?? I agree the room did shake with the passing of the underground and there was a bit of traffic noise however the hotel is on a main road and i would expect this to be the case whatever hotel i stayed in unless it was to have unbelievably good sound proofing! The room was a little small with little storage however i have to say it was one of the comfiest beds i have slept in, my room was clean and even though i didnt request clean towels every day i got them. I had chocolates on my pillow on arrival and the bathroom and shower were above my expectations. As for facilities, there was a tv, fridge, coffee making facilities and a safe (which i couldnt work) which is what you get in most good hotels. The room was a bit warm however if you keep the air con on all day then its fine and given the temp outside was mid 30's i couldnt expect it to be a cold room! The receptionist staff were extremely friendly and helpful and arranged my transport back to the airport. If you are looking for a good, relatively cheap, clean (in my opinion and i am fussy) friendly hotel in an excellent location to stay in when visiting New York which you wish use as a base for sleeping in then i would recommend this. I will definitely be going back to NYC and I will definitely consider returning to this hotel - unless of course i win the lottery then I will maybe be able to afford the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a good cleaning and upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: jaynedeaux
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews, price and location. It looks like it was once a nice, clean place, but it’s in need of some major upgrades. I wouldn’t return because the cons outweighed the pros during our stay. I don’t mind a small, simple room, but a dirty one is a no-go. PROS The front desk staff was friendly and helpful with directions. The location, for the price, was decent. The Canal subway stop is right outside. You can also easily walk through Soho to the West Village and the subway. CONS The bottom sheet on the bed didn’t cover the mattress- so the bottom half of your legs are on an unwashed mattress pad. Yuck. The carpet was dirty, covered in spots and in obvious need of replacement. Our toilet was in need of a good cleaning when we checked in. AC unit in room works only when you keep your room-key in the power slot by the door. Windows don’t open so you return to a stuffy, hot box at the end of the day. The building vibrated with the passing of the subway. The traffic noise (honking!) from Canal Street was incessant. (If it’s an option, I’d ask for a room that doesn’t face Canal.) Not the worst hotel ever but not one to which I’d return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect IF you value location above facilities”
Reviews.Author: Griff92
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking of coming here, I think the decision's pretty simple: make sure you know what you want out of a holiday and it's pretty clear which criteria this hotel fulfils and which ones it doesn't! If you're looking for a good location and view your room as just a place to rest at the end of the day and leave your stuff while you go wandering round, this hotel's spot on. On the other hand, if you see your hotel as a big part of the holiday experience, and want amenities beyond the basics, it isn't! The room was clean and had a TV, ensuite bathroom and good aircon (fortunately, as the NY record temperature was set while we were there!) The staff were very friendly too, and there was complimentary wifi. It's on Canal Street, which is a bustling street in Chinatown, so in the midst of the street sellers and "genuine" Chanel handbag stalls. Therefore, if you want a quiet or upmarket location, this isn't it. (Looking on Google Streetview gives you a good idea of all the hustle and bustle.) Having said that, the location's terrific: one of the Canal Street Metro stops is right outside the hotel, and the other is only a couple of blocks away so you've got a number of the metro lines right outside your door! The sound-proofing is very good, so the noise on the street isn't a problem. Having said that, the room was quite small (one bed for the three of us, although it was a big 'un!) It's a basic hotel. No real facilities as such, but it's cheap and in a great spot if you want to be in the middle of the action. No breakfast that we were aware of, but there's a great deli just round the corner on Broadway (called Jubilee Marketplace) that had a really good range of food.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very reasonably priced - but small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: shokel
Reviews.Content: We were budget conscious when booking our trip to New York and Hotel Azure is very good value. It is a very simple hotel without the extra services some hotels provide (no restaurant/catering, business centre, gym etc), however the hotel is very clean and rooms were serviced daily. The only downside is that the rooms are extremely small and two people struggle to move around the room with 2 large suitcases etc. We had to always have one suitcase up against the door, and then move it into the ensuite just to get in/out of the room! The location is fantastic - Canal St subway is just footsteps from the hotel, and you can access most areas of Manhattan from this subway location. Chinatown and Little Italy (stunning!) are just a short walk away also. The staff were very friendly and even helped book us a car to the airport the day before we left - the driver was there on time and took us straight to JFK without any stress. Overall, a very clean,simple, well priced hotel - great for single travellers, but maybe a little cramped for two!

Reviews.Title: “OK for solo traveler. Clean.”
Reviews.Author: keithb789
Reviews.Content: I have no major complaints about Hotel Azure but it was a mixed bag for me. I'm giving it a four rating, though I wish I could give it 3.5. It was decent overall, though basic. I've had better stays for the money in NYC. I was traveling alone and for one person the very small room was sufficient, for two it might be a stretch. Something new for me: there were only a few hooks on which to hang clothes - no closet and no drawers (I used the windowsill for drawers). The bed was comfortable, and despite being very near noisy/busy Canal Street, I slept well as I think the windows are high quality (there are also blackout shades). The AC worked well. The bathroom was the best part of the room - very nice blue tiled motif with a great shower. Staff was nice but not overly so, and there was nothing special in my interactions with them. Not much of a lobby. No breakfast or fitness room. Location: Canal Street is supremely annoying and crowded, but I liked the hotel's short distance to SoHo/Broadway shopping, Tribeca, East Village, West Village. All in all: I would stay again (especially for a good price) but it would not be my first choice hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Stuff stolen while in baggage”
Reviews.Author: jbae29
Reviews.Content: My company put me up in this hotel. The room was just slightly larger than the bed, with about a foot of space on each side of the bed and the walls. I figured at least it was close to where I needed to be. The next day, I checked my stuff, a luggage bag and a shopping bag, with the hotel for the day. I noticed they set all the luggages on the side but I figured they put all of them away at some point. When I showed up to pick up my luggage, it was already out in the hallway. The manager claimed he brought it up and kept on eye on it the whole time. Unfortunately, when I checked my shopping bag, my Gucci tie was missing. Since he was the only person on staff, I had to wait 15 minutes until the next person arrived before he could check to see if the tie fell out anywhere. After searching around he said he couldn't find it but would call me the next day to let me know if house keeping had found it. I ended up calling them the next evening only for him to tell me he would need a few more days. A few days goes by and I end up calling them again and he tells me they didn't find it and there's nothing he could do for me. He then says that he didn't remember seeing a tie in the bag anyway. Well, I actually had two ties in the bag and one was still there. It's bad enough someone stole my tie but this treatment from the assistant general manager made it worse.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asim099
Reviews.Content: Hotel Azure is good for the money and location. Yes, the rooms are are small but clean and lets face it you only sleep there. The beds are very confortable and come with a coffee machine and safe etc. It is right in the centre of China town and the buzz of Canal street - there is a Dunkin opposite and a 24hr Mc Donalds, plus loads other eating places. Soho is not far and little Italy is only a block or two away. The subway is very close and so going up down is easy. The staff were helpful and arranged our car to JFK for a good rate. It was a bit to down town for my liking but it is a nice long walk. If you want to be closer to Macy, Times Sq etc then this place might be to far down town but for the price I think it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff, and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BayTheMan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Azure is a great hotel. The rooms are small, however they are really clean, nice size bed, and all of the amenities of a large room at the more expensive hotels. The size was perfect for me. You are right at the BEST shopping at this place.. Right in SOHO... The subway station less than 100feet from the hotel lobby door. You can be from the hotel to Times Square in just minutes! The staff is really helpful as well. Very courteous! I will return DEFINITELY!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, friendly and helpful staff and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: MicfromBris
Reviews.Content: My son and I flew in from Australia and spent 4 nights at the Azure. The hotel room although small (to be expected in New York) was very clean and serviced daily and the beds were very comfortable. The staff were friendly and very helpful pointing us in the direction of restaurants, diners, shops and the metro and assisting us with a car service. The hotel was excellent value for money, in a great location and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cmorr79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Azure for seven nights with a friend. The hotel is in an awesome location, right next to Soho, China Town and Little italy. Out side there are two underground stations that can take you directly to Time Square, Central Park, south Manhatten (wall street-the ferry for Statute liberity) and brooklyn. The rooms were very clean and modern. The rooms are very small, but that is normal for New York, plus you dont spend much time in there any way. Staff were helpful and always happy to answer questions. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, good location, clean, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tishes
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and accommodating and everything was clean and comfortable. The location is great, right next to Chinatown and SoHo and minutes from Greenwich Village. This is a good thing because you'll want to spend most of your time outside since you really can't do much in the hotel room besides lie on the bed, as the rooms are TINY. Seriously, we just cracked up with laughter when we were let into the room, I had no idea you could fit a hotel room in such a small space. But if you're not claustrophobic then the hotel is perfectly adequate. We had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Clearly it depends what you are after... I thought it was perfect'”
Reviews.Author: Turn81
Reviews.Content: The mix of reviews shows the problem with NY being so vast- it depends on what you are after. Yes small rooms, but I wasnt in NY to spend time in a hotel room Location- Amazing, if you want to be in the heart of Soho near all the great shops, mercer st, etc. So easy to walk everywhere. Really can't complain. I thought it was very clean. Everywhere in new york is expensive, and really i didnt think was bad value for money at all. We had a corner room, which most likely should have been the noisiest of them all, but it wasnt- once the window was shut it really wasnt a problem. I would def recommend to anyone similar to me- 2 girls, late 20's, who just wanted to be in the heart of New York exploring what was in the city. I cant rate service, because apart from the door staff I never saw anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: wadena-2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Azure for 4 nights, the room was clean and comfy. Steve who worked downstairs was amazing and willing to help find us anything and everything!! NYC is the city that never sleeps so don't forget your ear plugs its very loud at times. The location was perfect!!!! the subway around the conner and Soho in walking distance. This is a great place to stay if you want somewhere to stay if you plan on being busy during your stay. The price and the location is well worth it!!! we will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: schmarro
Reviews.Content: Affordable hotel in a great location. clean, but small rooms, ac and internet included, not so great staff but the location + price makes it worthwhile for 1-3 nights at manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: rphs111
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but very clean and great location. Staff was extremely helpful. Hotel is good for a night or two after that might feel a little cramped. We used the room just to sleep, there is a small desk if needed.

Reviews.Title: “dont go there please”
Reviews.Author: MARA R
Reviews.Content: i was in new york from 12 to 20, i make a reservation at the azure, the girl at the front desk was really nusty, the hotel is umbeliveble small, the room are the smaller i ever see, also is really expe,

Reviews.Title: “Checked in & checked right back out”
Reviews.Author: Mxjunke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were honeymooning in DC and took the train to NYC for 1 night. We checked in and checked right back out. The room was not acceptable. The floor was not vaccummed and there were stains all over the carpet and bedspread. The air conditioner barely worked and it smelled like urine. Horrible experience, not to mention they did not credit us back. We walked down the street to the Holiday Inn and had a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: riotkittyb
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for a class, and this hotel exceeded both my needs and expectations. It is simple and clean, and the location was perfect for access to Soho, Chinatown, and the Village. The 32 inch flatscreen tv had more channels than I could ever need. The front desk staff was friendly, efficient, and helpful. I wanted to bring the bed home with me, and the tile in the bathroom was a nice touch. Some have complained of the subway noise, but it was irrelevent for me being on the 3rd floor. The vendors on canal street seem to have annoyed some people, but I hardly noticed it except to be amused. The only thing I can say is that if you are sensitive to noise bring earplugs to sleep, because the honking can be excessive at times. The size of the room was not overly small for me, but I was alone, so.....

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, simple, convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Random_Wanderer00
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Stayed here in July 2009, it was a nice stay and reasonably priced considering the location and the time of year. The hotel and rooms are clean and have a very modern, IKEA like look. There is no gym/pool/restaurant...etc, rooms were small but I didn't spend much time in the rooms anyway so it didn't bother me. I was a little shocked by the rumblings of the subway below during my first night but got used to it, if you're a light sleeper this may be a big problem! The staff was generally nice, though one gentleman that worked there was a fairly abrasive and unfriendly. Location: Location is excellent as it's close to a bunch of the subway lines. If you're looking for a place to get away from all the other tourists in town this is the place for you -there are other little boutique hotels sparsely placed in the neighbourhood, but definitely no big chain hotels. For all the foodies out there, the hotel is a very short walk to little italy, chinatown, and all the soho/lower east side restaurants/bars, and a 20-30 min walk or quick subway ride to greenwich village. Nightlife: The immediate area is a bit dead at night, which is a bit surprising as it's so close to Little Italy & in Chinatown but there are lots of late night restaurants/bars/clubs in surrounding neighbourhoods. All in all, I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you just need a place to sleep at night and not looking for all the bells & whistles that chain hotels offer.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated, great value”
Reviews.Author: joopy86
Reviews.Content: I took a chance with Azure recently when I wanted somewhere to stay downtown that was in a great location, inexpensive, and clean. After reading numerous tripadvisor reviews and comparing prices, locations, and all I settled on Azure, despite the number of recently negative reviews that popped up regarding this place. When I checked in, I'd expected the worse -- but was pleasantly surprised by how great my stay was. I should say, however, that I'm a native New Yorker; which might factor into my lack of complaints about the noise/size of the place. First of all, ANY place you stay downtown will be noisy, particularly on one of the major arteries of traffic in the city. Having stayed at the Soho Grand a few blocks away, at almost triple the price of Azure, the room was not that much smaller by size, although Soho Grand had a closet while this place did not. The bathrooms were spotless, the bed (I had the King sized room, which was only $20 more expensive than the Queen) was large and comfortable and spotless, and the space was maximized to best possible use. Is it a fancy hotel? No. But as the adage goes, sometimes simpler is better. What you can expect is a small, 80's esque lobby with some brochures and a polite, helpful person that will smoothly check you in and out. The hallways and lobby is a bit shopworn, but the rooms are perfect and clean and the bathrooms have huge, overhead shower heads with great water pressure. If you know the city well, you'll know that there's nothing more fantastic than a clean, comfortable place on Lafayette with walking access to Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown, and the Lower East Side for under $200.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smilesMAKEtheWORLD
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful two night stay. The bed was amazing better than my one at home. The room was small but big enough for the two of us. It a was clean, convenient and friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lovetravellingDakar
Reviews.Content: situated in great location.. rooms VERY small.. great for singles

Reviews.Title: “Pack sleeping tablets”
Reviews.Author: JM452
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for five nights. The room was small but clean, modern and nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable and for tourists only needing somewhere to sleep it did the job - almost. Our room was on the second floor and the noise of traffic and subway during the night made us both resort to sleeping tablets even thought I can normally sleep through anything. The location was very convenient and the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of This Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: epiland
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in the hotel for two nights. The hotel is close to Canal St. which is very busy and loud. The bed vibrates every night as the subway passes underneath it which wakes you up - the first night it happened I thought it was an earthquake! The heater was either blasting away or blowing freezing air - no medium heat!. The continental breakfast consist of COSTCO muffins and bad coffee. The worst thing was my two wake up calls were missed which caused me to oversleep and miss an important business meeting. I called the hotel after I returned to Boston and all the management would offer me is a 39.00 credit for the mishap!!! I will not recommend this hotel to anyone as well as stay clear of Hotel Azure on future visits to NYC!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the staff!”
Reviews.Author: lquinnosu
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel, opened approximately 3 months ago. My friend and I chose the hotel due to location and price; BTW, it is NOT located in Soho, rather it is in the heart of Chinatown. However, we overlooked the location because we had planned to visit Chinatown during our stay. The hotel rooms are tiny, comparable to what a prison cell may feel like. The shower head in the bathroom had the force of a light drizzle and went from cold, to scalding, to cold, to scalding. The worst experience of the trip was when the hotel maid cleaned our room and "mistakenly" removed a new pair of boots I had purchased the night prior at Shoegasm. When the "error" was brought to the attention of the staff (Johnna and Julie), they chose to believe their staff over a customer who had paid $850 to stay there for 2 nights. Whatever happened to the customer is always right? Neither manager I spoke with, Julie or Joe Ngai, were helpful and instead maintained their staff did not see the boots while cleaning the room or sifting through the trash. And instead of offering a reasonable refund (less than $100), they demanded I file a report with NYPD less than one hour prior to my departure from the city, which would be forwarded to their insurance company. I am still waiting on a resolution on this matter; however, I am not hopeful as the staff is sticking with its own and the manager, Julie, refused to verify there were no boots in my room or luggage as offered. I am highly disappointed in the staff's response to my incident and I do NOT recommend the hotel for anyone due to my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nicely formed”
Reviews.Author: randomtask
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Location is a fairly busy corner of Canal St - a great base for exploring downtown Manhattan. Soho, Tribeca, East Village are all within walking distance. Positives - new, well presented rooms. Great shower only bathrooms. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Helpful and laid back staff. Free internet access if you've got a laptop (ask reception for a cable). Complimentary bottled water and tea/coffee. Pastries and fruit provided in foyer daily. Excellent location for seeing the lower half of Manhattan (the best part, away from tourist traps around midtown) Negatives - very small rooms, even by NY standards. Our twin was really the size of a single. TV was temperemental - not a key concern for me but a bit disappointing, Not much storage space for two people, nowhere to really store luggage away and no in-room safe (currently). Can be rather noisy too - Canal St is a busy traffic hotspot and the sound isolation isn't really the best if you're given a room facing the traffic. As long as you can get past these negatives and are prepared for a compact space, it's a nice handy place to stay in the lower part of Manhattan. For travellers like me who can do without the non-essential bells and whistles the pricier hotels may offer, it was a reasonable compromise to make.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location! Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetbb
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC recently on a 3 day business trip and stayed at this hotel. Hotel is in a great downtown location. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean & beds are very comfortable. I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Azure and I plan on staying there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing bed”
Reviews.Author: cupcake84
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in nyc but this hotel was the most attentive. The hotel was fashionable and very clean. Very close to soho and shopping, a major plus. Good pizza close by as well. The manager recommended a great french restuarant, ask for recommendations! The staff was warm and welcoming, very professional. The rooms were very stylish and the beds were amazing, the best sleep I've had in a long time.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Azure
HotelInfo.Address: 120 Lafayette Street, New York City, NY 10013
